Description: Three fragments of papyrus. Fragment 1: 11 lines of Coptic written along the fibres (recto) with palimpsest of approx. 8 lines of Coptic beneath, 4 lines of Coptic with palimpsest of 10 lines of Coptic beneath it, written against the fibres (verso). Fragment 2: 4 lines of Coptic written along the fibres (recto), 2 lines against the fibres (verso). Fragment 3: 10 lines of Coptic written along the fibres (recto), 5 lines against the fibres (verso) with a palimpsest of a further 3 lines beneath. Fragments 2 and 3 are from the same text.
Bibliographic references: Crum 1921 / Short Texts from Coptic Ostraca and Papyri (no. 175)
Ede 1972- / Writing and lettering in antiquity (1975 no. 39, 1999 no. 40)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (706196) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/706196)
